identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study of SPY001-001 in Healthy Volunteers
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase 1, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Single and Multiple Ascending Dose Study of the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of SPY001-001 in Healthy Participants

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is a Phase 1, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, single- and multiple-dose, first in human safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetic study of SPY001-001 in healthy participants.

armGroups.label: SAD Cohorts 1-5 Experimental Arm
armGroups.description: Participants will receive a single dose of SPY001-001 in a dose escalation format

armGroups.label: SAD Cohorts 1-5 Placebo Arm
armGroups.description: Participants will receive a single dose of placebo

armGroups.label: MAD Cohorts 1-3 Experimental Arm
armGroups.description: Participants will receive two doses of SPY001-001 in a dose escalation format

armGroups.label: MAD Cohorts 1-3 Placebo Arm
armGroups.description: Participants will receive two doses of placebo

armGroups.label: SAD Cohorts 6-7 Experimental Arm
armGroups.description: Participants of Japanese descent will receive a single dose of SPY001-001

armGroups.label: SAD Cohorts 6-7 Placebo Arm
armGroups.description: Participants of Japanese descent will receive a single dose of placebo

armGroups.label: SAD Cohorts 8-9 Experimental Arm
armGroups.description: Participants of Chinese descent will receive a single dose of SPY001-001

armGroups.label: SAD Cohorts 8-9 Placebo Arm
armGroups.description: Participants of Chinese descent will receive a single dose of placebo

primaryOutcomes.description: Incidence, severity, and causal relationship of TEAEs

secondaryOutcomes.description: Maximum concentration after single and multiple ascending doses
Time to reach maximum concentration after single and multiple ascending doses
Half life after single and multiple doses
Area under the curve after single and multiple ascending doses
Incidence of anti-drug antibody after single and multiple ascending doses

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Healthy men and women
* Willing and able to attend the necessary visits to the CRU, comply with all testing requirements, remain at the study site unit for the duration of the confinement period and return for the outpatient visits

Exclusion Criteria:

* Participation in more than one cohort
* Evidence of clinically significant abnormality or disease
* Known history of illicit drug use or drug abuse, harmful alcohol use or alcoholism, and/or smoking or nicotine-containing product use within 3 months prior to the first dose of study drug
* History of severe allergic reactions or hypersensitivity
* Donation or loss of \>1 unit of whole blood within 1 month prior to dosing
